area_name: Five Point to a Fist Crag

content.description:
Start the same as "

Middle Finger

" and traverse under the bulge (or just go straight up to avoid a lot of rope drag) and go up the groove. Like any good marriage, there were some rough spots. I had one stopper behind a chunk of rock that I could move with my hand but couldn't pull all the way off! (Bomber Mental Gear) Before this piece was a little run out.
content.protection: Mostly stoppers in the medium range, some finger-sized cams (perhaps TCUs) could be helpful.
content.location:
To the left of "

Middle Finger

."

content.description:
Start in the same place as

Middle Finger

, but go to the right immediately so that you are on the grey face to the right. Take the tiny, finger crack through the open dihedral, at the top of the crack go left to the anchor.
Climb the small, hand crack to the bulge passing it on the right through the fist crack to the anchor.
content.protection: Stoppers work well on the bottom then bring some good, fist-sized cams (probably two) for the upper crack.

pathTokens: Five Point to a Fist Crag
